name: Princess Hotel & Casino

reviews.title: Amazing scenery! Beautiful place
reviews.text: Ive been here just once and although the scenery was amazing and the atmosphere was brilliant it was less than I imagined, it boasted to be one of the best but the furnitures were crumbling apart, if it has singed been changed I would sure hope so. The third floor scenery is beautiful and I would recommend asking for a room on the third floor, I never did use any of the amenities that hey offered not even the free breakfast, I'm just nit that early of a person but it was a nice stay with everything in the compound!

I stayed only one night at the hotel due to an unexpected stay in Belize. It is a decent average hotel and considered one of the nicer places to stay in Belize City. If you are looking for a little night time activity there is a casino right within the hotel. The room, which was a fairly basic hotel room was clean and had a nice view of the bay. You have a choice of dining at the Calypso restaurant right on the dock or the restaurant inside the hotel. The breakfast was complimentary and was excellent, including eggs cooked to order. It is not a 5 star hotel but for a couple of nights it fits the bill.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel in the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well me and my hubby needed a weekend get away so we decided to stay at the princess. I was a bit skeptical because I had stayed here some years ago and it was kind of run down. Well they did not disappoint the rooms have been renovated my room had a king size bed, AC a futon a flat screen TV plus an extra sofa and a table. Minor problem the closet was broken. The food was excellent downstairs and the casino well not so good seems its hard to win there now. But honestly we were well satisfied and kudos to the lovely creole young lady at the front desk with a sense of humor she really brightened our day. Great Job princess keep it up
reviews.title: Princess is getting its groove back

reviews.text: The hotel was so-so, however there aren't many options for major chains in Belize City. The hotel is very outdated although the room was pretty clean. The amenities are very basic and by no means luxury. The Hotel restaurant was good and the staff there was Excellent..very attentive, friendly and helpful. The Seafood restaurant out on the bay out back of the hotel didn't give us a warm feeling so we ate inside both days. The bay out back is pretty dirty and ugly..as well as smelly. We did feel fairly safe here given all the comments we heard from locals about not going out into Belize City at night.
reviews.title: So-So Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably won't visit Belize again, but if we did we would look at other options as well.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: The hotel smells awful! The ocean front is full of seaweed an smells like sewage. The food was edible, but not very good. A/C didn't work in 3 out of the 4 rooms our group had. My guess is that this was a nice hotel when it was built, but that was a long time ago.
reviews.title: Not impressed!

reviews.text: In one sentence, I got a very itching bug in my skin within 3 nights there. It's like they don't laundry bed clothes at all. The sea food restaurant had an angry lady a very good chef Who saves the restaurant , but the quality of the ingredients is in doubt
reviews.title: Man, you got to skip this

reviews.text: Situated right on the seafront by the Belize city marina, the best argument for chosing this hotel is the great sea view, spacious guest rooms and the Calypso restaurant. The huge lobby contains several shops, a bar, and a nice seafood restaurant.
reviews.title: Good value with sea view

reviews.text: "You never get a second chance to make the first impression", is a well known phrase, and our first impression was unfortunately rather quite average. The receptionist was ok, but nothing more. (A lack of service was also the impression by the the local tourorgianzator that called the hotel in order to get in touch with us). The Caribbean sea view from the guest rooms are awesome, but the lack of a balcony disappointed us, even though the hotel is a typical city/business-hotel, and not a beach hotel.
reviews.title: Good Deal for the price but out of town

reviews.text: On the positive side, the seafood restaurant was nice, and the staff was really nice and attentive! Proffessional and informal at the same time, just the way you´d expect in the Caribbean.
reviews.title: A nice hotel at a decent price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This would be a good place to stay for 1 or 2 nights but not longer. Not much to do around this hotel as there is no beach in Belize City, you have to go out of town to find one. The hotel itself is in much need of updating and they are starting to work on this. The restaurant on the water is very good to eat in. Staff was excellent.
reviews.title: Much needed renovations being done now.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here only for one night...the hotel was clean, quiet, and safe....the staff were very nice and accomodating. We felt it was a little expensive for Central America (we live in Honduras) at $126 per night. The hotel room itself was nothing fancy....... but it did have a comfortable King Size Bed...and the casino was a nice diversion. Fun. As for the WiFi in the rooms... our standards are not very high as we live in Roatan Honduras where the internet has been spotty at best over the past 5 years. We'd likely stay here again, though it should probably be about $60 or $75 a night...not $126.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, safe hotel....

reviews.text: After pulling into town and sizing up the very few options which ranged from outrageously overpriced to downright scary, we settled on the Princess. The rooms were adequate and clean, but the wifi in the rooms was awful as stated elsewhere. It worked well in the lobby/bar/restuarant. The parking area in front had security, which is definitely necessary. Service was generally unenthusiatic, but with a few exceptional employees. Overpriced, but it did include the (mediocre) breakfast buffet. Dinner was good though, I had the best grouper sandwich in memory.
reviews.title: slim pickings brought us to this place

reviews.text: Hotel door left open pool dirty construction noise in hotel staff lazy and don't care only a few people cared not safe area managers don't appreciate your business and won't fix the problem it's a real joke there is way better hotels and I sure don't recommend this hotel
reviews.title: Terrible place

reviews.text: We stayed here one night before we went to San Pedro. The hotel was average. The hotel clean and the employees were nice.
reviews.title: Best place for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Things got off on the wrong foot at the Princess. The front desk staff was not friendly. The national language is english, so I know they understand people from the states. Or is it that the front desk girls don't like Americans.The key to our room did not work in the lock. After standing in the heat and humidity for a hour, we were finally let in our room. We found out that the batteries in the door lock were dead. It took another hour for the maintanance guys, (that's right 2) to change the batteries in the lock, as the hotel did not give the maintanance guys access to batteries.
reviews.title: This Princess is not Royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now in the room, there is no hot water or water pressure. The refrigerator did not work. I took off the shower head a knocked out the grit, but after 2 minutes it was clogged again.
reviews.title: Do yourself a favor, stay at the Radisson.

reviews.text: The brighter side of our stay at the Princess was the breakfast our room came with was good. Fresh fruit, made to order omelets, and the restaurant staff was good. They were personable and we had great conversation with them. Maybe the hotel should put the restaurant staff behind the front desk.The pool was nice. The AC was cold, and all rooms have an ocean view. There is a movie theater that shows first run movies and a snack bar.The adjacent restaurant has great food. The hotel is in the better side of Belize City and is safer to walk in than South Belize City.
reviews.title: Short stay in Belize City

reviews.text: Although the Princess is in a better neighborhood, I don't believe it justifies the room rate or was the safety feature included in our room rate?
reviews.title: Main things not working here!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Radisson Fort George and at the Princesses. Trust me Radisson is better. Here is a rundown of the Princess.
reviews.title: Still needs work but good enough

description: The Princess Hotel and Casino is strategically located in the central business district of Belize City. With 170 newly renovated ocean view rooms, it boasts the largest entertainment center in the country to include Las Vegas Style Casino, over-the-water Seafood Restaurant and bar, air conditioned indoor restaurant and bar, two cinemas showing latest releases, arcade, bowling alley, swimming pool, fitness center,nightclub,Hair Salon,massage center 24 hour room service and 24 hour reception.
